Cauchy estimates

A holomorphic function f ⁣:C→C\func{f}{\C}{\C}f:C→C is said to be of exponential type if there are constants c1,c2>0c_1, c_2 > 0c1​,c2​>0 such that

∣f(z)∣≤c1ec2∣z∣for allz∈C.\abs{f\p{z}} \leq c_1e^{c_2\abs{z}} \quad\text{for all}\quad z \in \C.∣f(z)∣≤c1​ec2​∣z∣for allz∈C.

Show that fff is of exponential type if and only of f′f'f′ is of exponential type.
Solution.

"  ⟹  \implies⟹"

Suppose fff is of exponential type with constants c1,c2c_1, c_2c1​,c2​. Let z∈Cz \in \Cz∈C and C(z,R)C\p{z, R}C(z,R) the circle of radius RRR centered at zzz. We get the Cauchy estimate

∣f′(z)∣=∣12πi∫C(z,R)f(ζ)(ζ−z)2 dζ∣≤12π⋅2πR⋅sup⁡ζ∈C(z,R)c1ec2∣ζ∣R2≤c1Rec2∣z∣+c2R=(c1Rec2R)ec2∣z∣.\begin{aligned} \abs{f'\p{z}} &= \abs{\frac{1}{2\pi i} \int_{C\p{z,R}} \frac{f\p{\zeta}}{\p{\zeta - z}^2} \,\diff\zeta} \\ &\leq \frac{1}{2\pi} \cdot 2\pi R \cdot \sup_{\zeta \in C\p{z,R}} \frac{c_1e^{c_2\abs{\zeta}}}{R^2} \\ &\leq \frac{c_1}{R}e^{c_2\abs{z}+c_2R} \\ &= \p{\frac{c_1}{R}e^{c_2R}}e^{c_2\abs{z}}. \end{aligned}∣f′(z)∣​=∣∣​2πi1​∫C(z,R)​(ζ−z)2f(ζ)​dζ∣∣​≤2π1​⋅2πR⋅ζ∈C(z,R)sup​R2c1​ec2​∣ζ∣​≤Rc1​​ec2​∣z∣+c2​R=(Rc1​​ec2​R)ec2​∣z∣.​

Since R>0R > 0R>0 is a fixed constant, f′f'f′ is of exponential type.

"  ⟸  \impliedby⟸"

Suppose f′f'f′ is of exponential type with constants c1,c2c_1, c_2c1​,c2​ and let z∈Cz \in \Cz∈C. Consider the segment γ\gammaγ parametrized by t↦tzt \mapsto tzt↦tz, so that by the fundamental theorem of calculus,

f(z)=f(0)+∫γf′(z) dz.f\p{z} = f\p{0} + \int_{\gamma} f'\p{z} \,\diff{z}.f(z)=f(0)+∫γ​f′(z)dz.

Then

∣f(z)∣≤∣f(0)∣+∫γ∣f′(z)∣ d∣z∣≤∣f(0)∣+∣z∣c1ec2∣z∣≤∣f(0)∣e(c2+1)∣z∣+c1e(c2+1)∣z∣=(∣f(0)∣+c1)e(c1+1)∣z∣,\begin{aligned} \abs{f\p{z}} &\leq \abs{f\p{0}} + \int_\gamma \abs{f'\p{z}} \,\diff\abs{z} \\ &\leq \abs{f\p{0}} + \abs{z}c_1e^{c_2\abs{z}} \\ &\leq \abs{f\p{0}}e^{\p{c_2+1}\abs{z}} + c_1e^{\p{c_2+1}\abs{z}} \\ &= \p{\abs{f\p{0}} + c_1}e^{\p{c_1+1}\abs{z}}, \end{aligned}∣f(z)∣​≤∣f(0)∣+∫γ​∣f′(z)∣d∣z∣≤∣f(0)∣+∣z∣c1​ec2​∣z∣≤∣f(0)∣e(c2​+1)∣z∣+c1​e(c2​+1)∣z∣=(∣f(0)∣+c1​)e(c1​+1)∣z∣,​

since ex≥xe^x \geq xex≥x and ex≥1e^x \geq 1ex≥1 for x≥0x \geq 0x≥0. Hence, fff is of exponential type as well.
